item.title: Anthony Lester
item.description:
Anthony Lester

This is my scrapbook of all things that interest, amuse, fascinate and inspire me in the world of swimming, cycling and running. I could have done it on facebook but all my friends and family are probably sick to death of my constant witterings and ramblings.Â

item.title: How parkrun became a global phenomenon
item.description:
How parkrun became a global phenomenon

On Saturday at 9am, about 80,000 people - more than twice the number who take part in the London Marathon - will gather in parks across the country to run, jog and walk five kilometres. Parents with buggies, children and grandparents, super-fit sprinters, dog walkers and people with disabilities, as well as volunteers, will come together at hundreds of courses across the UK.

item.title: Advanced Marathoning
item.description:
Advanced Marathoning

The Pfitzinger & Douglas (P&D) training plan, interesting reading even the second time. Two years on from my last sub-3 hour attempt I am going for it again.

item.description: 16 week @BrightonMarathn training programme started today with a 35 degree 10km. #hot #Winterwarmweathertraining . http://connect.garmin.com/modern/activity/994045688 ...

item.title: Five Tips for the Corporate Runner
item.description:
Five Tips for the Corporate Runner

Whether a runner, triathlete or any other type of athlete also holding down a full-time job, there are a number of challenges facing us both physical and organisational, many of which our colleagues will never fully comprehend. Here are some ideas which may help your training:

item.title: Transition from pool to open water swimming
item.description:
Transition from pool to open water swimming

Make your first splash into open water with these tips from open water expert Adam Walker

item.title: Energy drinks run out of fizz as scientists discover spoonful of sugar in water has same effect
item.description:
Energy drinks run out of fizz as scientists discover spoonful of sugar in water has same effect

However, researchers found that combining different sources of sugars improves the rate at which people can absorb them from the gut. In a new study, published in the American Journal of Physiology - Endocrinology & Metabolism, they assessed the impact of endurance exercise on liver glycogen levels.

item.title: A long running myth - Athletics Weekly
item.description:
A long running myth - Athletics Weekly

Running has a reputation as being bad for your joints and bad for your heart. Indeed, non-runners will tell you that it is an activity as beneficial to your knees as hitting them with a hammer and is more likely to cut your life short than enhance it.

item.title: 50 Milestone
item.description:
50 Milestone

6 year old Ollie reaches the 50 runs milestone with a 5km PB of 28:57
